reviews.text: I found the Fourposter Lodge to be a professionally run, perfectly acceptable B&B in an ideal location for visiting friends.
reviews.title: Clean, old house on outskirts of York

likes.liked: — The constant clunks which sounded like an air lock in the water pipes.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived at the hotel we did feel a little like we were staying in someone's house (the owners actually appear to live next door) and our room (number 1) looked like the spare room. However, after a couple of hours we felt right at home.
reviews.title: A little dated inside but great stay nonetheless

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The decor is dated and our room was a bit small but we felt cosy and the bed was very comfortable. The en suite bathroom was perfectly adequate (although the shower was a little small for my 6'2" fiance) but it was very clean and the heating was always on which was a treat seeing as the weather was much colder than what we'd left in the South.
reviews.title: Very friendly service, would return
Wicked!!!
reviews.text: However, despite any gripes with the decor this B&B excelled in many other ways. Firstly, the onsite parking was free even though we found a space with no trouble on the street behind the Lodge. Secondly, the breakfast was excellent and the service was faultless. It was especially nice because the dining room had small tables rather than one big one, as some B&Bs do, so you had a little privacy along with the waitress service. Lastly, perhaps the best part was the location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Lodge is only a ten minute walk into town and is fine in darkness, although there is one small part of the walk which is down a cut through between houses which is darker than the rest of the journey. Apart from that the walk was no trouble and if you didn't want to go to the city centre for food then there were several places to eat and drink only minutes from the Lodge itself.
reviews.title: A Great Place to Stay in York

reviews.text: Overall we really enjoyed our stay at the Fourposter Lodge and would return there.
reviews.title: Ideal for weekend stay
